New Records: Leo Messi now holds the record for the most appearances in Copa America history.
Key Match Events: Julian Alvarez scored the opening goal for Argentina in the 48th minute after capitalizing on the goal being unguarded.
Lautaro Martinez doubled Argentina's lead in the 87th minute with a beautifully placed shot past Crepeau.
Emiliano Martinez made a crucial save to keep his clean sheet.
Messi missed a chance to double the lead in the 64th minute after his follow-up shot was blocked by Derek Austin Cornelius.
Argentina controlled 64.5% of possession, outshot Canada 19-10, and had seven corner kicks to Canada's four.
Both teams received two yellow cards each.
Pre-Game Insights: Leo Messi and Co. were heading into their Copa America opener behind four consecutive wins in international friendlies.
Canada's Alphonso Davies led the starting lineup as captain.
Argentina fans made their presence felt outside Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, sporting jerseys with Messi's name and number.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina secured a 2-0 win over Canada to gain three points and top position in Group A.
Messi struggled to find the back of the net all evening.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sergio Aguero presented the Copa America trophy before the match.
The match took place at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta.
